command: for p in 11111 22222 33333; do nc -u -z -w1 target.example "$p"; sleep 1; done && ssh -p 4422 user@target.example
explanation: Sends a sequence of UDP port knocks (11111, 22222, 33333) to signal a remote knock daemon/firewall to temporarily open SSH on port 4422, then immediately attempts an SSH connection. Detection: monitor for short, ordered bursts of UDP packets to high, normally closed ports; review firewall logs for repeated hits to uncommon UDP ports followed by new ACCEPT rules for an SSH port.
rationale_steps: Generate a specific UDP knock sequence to signal a hidden service.
Remote device updates its firewall to open SSH based on the observed sequence.
Immediately connect via SSH to the now-open port to establish persistence.
Detect by alerting on repeated, timed UDP hits to closed ports and sudden exposure of SSH ports.
